intro: Stachytarpheta gesnerioides var. gesnerioides, commonly known as the purpletop verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces spikes of purple to violet flowers, which bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its showy inflorescences attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
